newsitem.title: USA: IPG's Lowe Direct executives defect to new agency.
newsitem.headline: IPG's Lowe Direct executives defect to new agency.

text.p: A group of executives said on Friday they left Interpublic Group's Lowe Direct unit to start their own independent direct marketing agency.
Lowe Direct appointed Lynn Fantom as its new chief executive to take over for J. Robert Lieber, its former chief, who announced he would leave to become head of the new breakaway agency.
Four other top officials of Lowe Direct have joined the new shop, to be know as Lieber, Levett, Koenig, Farese and Babcock.
In the succession at Lowe Direct, Fantom will report to Lowe & Partners/SMS co-chairmen Marvin Sloves and Lee Garfinkel. Other appointments will be announced for Lowe Direct shortly, Lowe said.

Fantom is a long-time veteran of Draft Direct, another direct marketing agency acquired by Interpublic Group earlier this year. Under a new arrangement, Lowe Direct will draw on "an arms length basis" some capabilities and resources of the Draft Direct agency, Lowe said, without elaborating.
